content.description: Sit start the sloping arete with a good right hand sidepull on the slab. Pull on and move left on the lip of the boulder. Shoulder friction dependent moves gain a dihedral on the slab where an early topout is possible, or continue traversing around the corner. Keep going left if you want to be like Vincent before topping out and remember to breathe.
content.protection: 3 pads and a spotter or two. Vincent did 18 moves and had 13 pads along with a log bridge above the creek.
content.location: This climb is a bit tight at the start, and there is a rock that rises up behind the climber. This problem is the sloping lip found to the right of "Deep "N" Dirty".

content.description:
Start low on the arrete and use gastons on the arrete to gain the juggy side pull on the left side of the arrete. Climb up the arrete on the good holds on both sides and either top out to the left on jugs or continue right into the overhang and top out there. 

  Its probably a 3 to go left and a 4 to go right for the top outs.
content.location: Almost faces the outhouses. Its on the far side of the tunnel from the graffiti. The arrete is the left side of the tunnel entrance

content.description:
A funny (and fun) climb on the arete of the Wendy 77 boulder. Start by getting a toehook(s) on the arete and grabbing the hold you heelhook on on Down N Dirty (The Wendy 77 climb).  

  Pull up and make a span move out the the arete (maybe using a small crimp). Then figure out how to get to the top without dabbing (crux). A fun lowball with good movement and 10 feet from the parking lot.  

  Deep, Down, And Dirty V11/12 avoids the arete as far as I am aware.
content.protection: Pads, there is a rock right behind you.
content.location: The frontside of the Outhouse boulder. If you are walking towards the bathrooms, this is the last boulder on your left. It climbs the obvious overhanging arete and face.

content.description:
Update 8/27: I have renamed this to Deep N Dirty. Its the pinch line by the graffiti. Even though the Kemple guide describes Deep Down N Dirty as the climb starting by the graffiti, DDD actually starts to the right where you place your heel for the start of this line and climbs straight up. This is according to Pat Tracy who was one of the first to climb it. 

  Start with a left hand on a square crimp near the graffiti and a right hand on a pinch down low. Use a heel hook to get the slopey rail and 2 finger pinch. Big move to a jug then top out. Better climb than you'd think.
content.location: Outhouse boulder, opposite side of the cave as the Outhouse Arete.

content.description:
Start on the low block where you place your heel for Deep N Dirty. Climb straight up.

 Two distinct betas for this. There's the Pat Tracy way where you avoid the arete entirely and climb the overhang. Theres also the Aaron Nietzel way where you use the same start holds but do a big move out to the arete.
content.location: the rightmost climb near the Wendy 77 graffiti

content.description:
Start on a round left sidepull crimp and a sharp knife blade of an incut crimp. Big move to the flat slopey crimp rail out left, bump in to the left hand start hold and then choose your beta for getting to the arete. Rose move or toe hooks.

 Not recommended for people over like 160lbs. The right hand start hold flexes and needs reinforcement by glue.
content.location: On the overhang to the right of the Outhouse Arete.

content.description:
Sit start to the Backstabber. Start on the low jug with your right hand and pick a miniature crimp with your left hand. Fire up to the left hand start for the stand then come in to the right hand start and finish it as normal.

 As with the stand, not recommended for people over 160lbs until the flexy crimp gets reinforced with glue

pathTokens: Boulders Behind the Main Parking Lot/Visitor Center

content.description: This is a boulder that leans into another boulder and forms a tunnel of sorts. It usually has a small stream running through it, although it is sometimes dry. Has graffiti on it.
